resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
andygrove commented on pull request #5561: ARROW-6761: [Rust] Travis build now uses the correct Rust toolchain
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5561
 
 
   There is a compiler bug apparently in Rust 1.40.0-nightly so we need to keep using 1.39.0 for now.
   
   The Travis build script builds each subcrate individually and therefore wasn't picking up the `rust-toolchain` file in the root of the Rust project.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

andygrove commented on issue #5561: ARROW-6761: [Rust] Travis build now uses the correct Rust toolchain
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5561#issuecomment-537360081
 
 
   @paddyhoran I could use some help with this. I'm not sure if the travis build script is correct or not, specifically:
   
   ```
   # build entire project
   RUSTFLAGS="-D warnings" cargo build --all-targets
   
   # build Arrow crate without default features
   cp rust-toolchain arrow
   pushd arrow
   cargo build --no-default-features
   popd
   
   # run tests
   cargo test
   ```
   
   Is the intent to only run the tests after building arrow subcrate without default features?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

paddyhoran commented on issue #5561: ARROW-6761: [Rust] Travis build now uses the correct Rust toolchain
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5561#issuecomment-537494789
 
 
   > Is the intent to only run the tests after building arrow subcrate without default features?
   
   No it's not.  I believe the `cargo test` will trigger a new build without `--no-default-features` applied.  You can pass `--no-default-features` at the workspace level but it is not propagated down to the sub-crates.  This is why we move into the arrow sub-crate to test that no-SIMD builds and then move out again.  
   
   If we need to I think that copying the toolchain file and testing is the most pragmatic solution we don't want to maintain several toolchain files.
   
   It looks like [this](https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5561/commits/a65b890ecb991a5cd167bd63d207a9cbb91ccd24#diff-354f30a63fb0907d4ad57269548329e3L301-R301) was the issue, which makes sense as the windows builds were fine.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

paddyhoran commented on issue #5561: ARROW-6761: [Rust] Travis build now uses the correct Rust toolchain
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5561#issuecomment-537495760
 
 
   Are you sure that the sub-crates don't respect the toolchain file?  It could just be that env variables take priority over toolchain files?

andygrove commented on issue #5561: ARROW-6761: [Rust] Travis build now uses the correct Rust toolchain
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5561#issuecomment-537529735
 
 
   @paddyhoran I think you are correct that it was just the env var. The top level `rust-toolchain` is respected by the sub-crates.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description: Travis builds recently started failing with a Rust ICE (Internal Compiler Error) which has been reported to the Rust compiler team ([https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/64908]).
fields.summary: [Rust] Travis CI builds not respecting rust-toolchain

comments.body: I can reproduce this locally on my laptop so it's not specific to Travis.
The Travis build script builds each subcrate individually and therefore wasn't picking up the {{rust-toolchain}} file in the root of the Rust project.
